title: IN2 Supermart Responsive Marketing Website with Offers Management, SEO, and Contact CTAs

requirements.text: Create a modern, professional, fully responsive multi-page website for the grocery retail store IN2 Supermart using a bright, welcoming theme (green, orange, and white) with clean typography, mobile-first layouts, and smooth but subtle UI animations.

quotes: Create a modern, professional, and fully responsive website for a grocery retail store named IN2 Supermart
Use a bright, welcoming color scheme (green, orange, and white preferred).
Clean typography with easy readability.
Mobile-first responsive layout.
Modern UI with smooth animations

acceptanceCriteria: Site uses a consistent green/orange/white palette and readable typography across all pages.
All pages are mobile-first and adapt correctly to common breakpoints (mobile/tablet/desktop).
Animations are present (e.g., hover, section reveal, carousel transitions) and do not block interaction or reduce readability.
Design reflects a premium supermarket feel with a local Indian neighborhood market vibe (visual styling only; no new features implied).

requirements.text: Implement the required pages and navigation: Home, About Us, Categories, Offers & Deals, and Visit Store / Contact. Ensure navigation works on mobile (hamburger menu) and desktop (top nav), and include a footer with address and quick links.

quotes: Pages to Include: Home Page ... About Us ... Categories Section ... Offers & Deals Page ... Visit Store / Contact Page

acceptanceCriteria: Each required page is accessible via client-side navigation and has a distinct route/screen.
Navigation is usable on mobile and desktop.
Footer includes store name, full address, and links to the main pages.

requirements.text: Build the Home page sections and content: hero banner with the tagline “Fresh Groceries. Smart Prices. Near You.”; highlights for offers, daily essentials, and featured categories; quick links to shop categories; and trust indicators emphasizing quality products, affordable pricing, and local convenience.

quotes: Hero banner with tagline like: “Fresh Groceries. Smart Prices. Near You.”
Highlight offers, daily essentials, and featured categories.
Quick links to shop categories.
Trust indicators (quality products, affordable pricing, local convenience).

acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero prominently displays the exact tagline text.
Home page includes sections for offers/promotions, daily essentials, featured categories, and trust indicators.
Category quick links navigate to the Categories page and/or on-page category section.

requirements.text: Create an About Us page describing IN2 Supermart as a reliable local grocery destination in Sonipat, focusing on freshness, value-for-money, and customer satisfaction, with friendly-yet-professional tone.

quotes: Describe IN2 Supermart as a reliable local grocery destination in Sonipat.
Focus on freshness, value-for-money, and customer satisfaction.
Friendly yet professional.

acceptanceCriteria: About page copy explicitly mentions Sonipat and emphasizes freshness, value, and customer satisfaction.
Tone reads friendly yet professional (no slang, no overly corporate wording).

requirements.text: Create a Categories page/section displaying clear category cards for: Fruits & Vegetables, Dairy & Bakery, Packaged Foods, Household Essentials, Beverages & Snacks, and Personal Care. Include relevant visuals and concise descriptive subtitles for each category.

quotes:
Categories Section
Fruits & Vegetables
Dairy & Bakery
Packaged Foods
Household Essentials
Beverages & Snacks
Personal Care

acceptanceCriteria: All six categories are shown with consistent card styling.
Each category has a visual (image or illustration) and a short description.
Layout is responsive (grid on desktop, stacked or 2-column on mobile as appropriate).

requirements.text: Implement an Offers & Deals page that shows weekly promotions and a “Today’s Special Discounts” section, highlighting savings messaging aimed at families and students.

quotes:
Offers & Deals Page
Weekly promotions
“Today’s Special Discounts”
Highlight savings for families and students.

acceptanceCriteria: Offers page includes a Weekly Promotions section and a Today’s Special Discounts section with clearly labeled headings.
Offer cards/banners show at minimum: title, short description, and validity period (or placeholder when not set).
Copy includes savings-oriented messaging relevant to families and students.

requirements.text: Add a “Why Choose Us” section (on Home and/or as a dedicated section on a relevant page) listing: Affordable pricing, Wide product range, Convenient neighborhood location, Friendly service, Fresh stock daily.

quotes:
Why Choose Us Section
Affordable pricing
Wide product range
Convenient neighborhood location
Friendly service
Fresh stock daily

acceptanceCriteria: All five bullets appear in the UI with clear icons or visual emphasis.
Section is responsive and readable on small screens.

requirements.text: Create a Visit Store / Contact page that includes: an embedded Google Map (iframe embed acceptable), the full store address (No. 134 Basement, 135P, Sector 23, Sonipat, Haryana – 131001, India), store hours (Open daily, closes at 10 PM), directions prompt, and a contact number placeholder.

quotes:
Visit Store / Contact Page
Google Map integration.
Store address and directions.
Store timing: Open daily, closes at 10 PM.
Contact number placeholder.

acceptanceCriteria: Contact page shows the exact provided address text.
Store hours are displayed and include “Open daily” and “closes at 10 PM”.
A Google Map embed is visible (using an iframe embed is acceptable).
A phone number placeholder is visible and clearly labeled.

requirements.text: Add conversion CTAs site-wide: a floating WhatsApp contact button for quick inquiries and a click-to-call action (tel: link) using the phone placeholder; ensure both are accessible and do not obstruct key content on mobile.

quotes: WhatsApp contact button for quick inquiries.
Click-to-call feature.

acceptanceCriteria: WhatsApp CTA is visible (floating or persistent placement) and links to a WhatsApp action using a placeholder number until finalized.
Click-to-call uses a tel: link with the same placeholder number.
On mobile, CTAs do not cover primary navigation or core content (tested on narrow viewport).

requirements.text: Implement offer banner management so offers/deals content can be updated without changing frontend code: create backend data structures and API methods to list/create/update/delete offers (including fields for title, description, discount/label, start/end date, and active flag), and create a simple admin UI to manage these offers.

quotes: Offer banner management.
Easy to update offers and content.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to: fetch active offers (public) and create/update/delete offers (admin-only).
Frontend Offers page renders from backend-provided offer data and updates after changes without redeploying the frontend.
Admin UI supports creating, editing, deleting, and toggling active status for offers, and includes validation for required fields (e.g., title).

requirements.text: Protect offer management actions so only authorized store admins can modify offers: use Internet Identity authentication and restrict admin methods in the Motoko canister to an allowlist of admin principals configurable in code (initially a single placeholder admin principal).

quotes: Easy to update offers and content.

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users can view offers but cannot call create/update/delete methods (backend rejects).
Authenticated non-admin users cannot modify offers (backend rejects).
Authenticated admin can perform CRUD operations successfully via the admin UI.

requirements.text: Implement SEO-ready structure and local SEO optimization: set page titles/meta descriptions, ensure correct heading hierarchy, add structured data (LocalBusiness/GroceryStore schema) with store name and address, and include target keywords: “Supermarket in Sonipat”, “Grocery Store Sector 23 Sonipat”, “Daily Needs Store Near Me”.

quotes:
SEO optimization for keywords like:
“Supermarket in Sonipat”
“Grocery Store Sector 23 Sonipat”
“Daily Needs Store Near Me”
SEO-ready structure.
Optimized for local search visibility.

acceptanceCriteria: Each page has a unique, relevant title and meta description.
Pages use a sensible H1/H2/H3 hierarchy (one H1 per page).
Structured data is present and includes store name and full address.
The specified keywords appear naturally in page copy and/or metadata (not keyword-stuffed).

requirements.text: Optimize performance and loading: ensure images are optimized and responsive, use lazy-loading where appropriate, minimize layout shift for hero/offer sections, and keep animations lightweight.

quotes: Fast loading and optimized performance.

acceptanceCriteria: Largest images use appropriately sized assets and do not load at full resolution on mobile unnecessarily.
Non-critical images below the fold are lazy-loaded.
Hero section renders without major layout shift (no large content jumps after load).

requirements.text: Add high-quality grocery and lifestyle imagery throughout the site (hero, categories, offers) using generated static assets and ensure consistent visual style aligned with a premium supermarket look and local Indian neighborhood feel.

quotes: Include high-quality grocery visuals and lifestyle imagery.

acceptanceCriteria: Hero, category cards, and at least one offers banner include high-quality imagery.
All imagery is served as static assets from the frontend and looks cohesive in style/color grading.
Images are responsive and do not appear stretched or pixelated on common screen sizes.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (compose UI components instead of modifying read-only sources).
Use English for all user-facing website text.
Google Map integration must be implemented without requiring unsupported third-party backend integrations (iframe embed is acceptable).
nonGoals: E-commerce functionality (cart, checkout, payments, inventory, delivery scheduling).
User accounts for shoppers beyond what is needed for admin offer management.
Real-time chat or messaging beyond WhatsApp deep link.
Integration with external CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress) or external databases.
